comment.author: 8892367@N05
comment._content: Hi Claudie C-G, The border on this lantern slide is original. A lantern slide is a photographic positive printed on glass. Often, opaque paper (usually black or another dark color) was used as a matt or mask on top of the photograph for aesthetic purposes, and to mask out edges or parts of the image not wanted in the frame. Finally, a second protective glass slide was added on top to protect the photographic print and to keep the matt in place and the two glass slides would be bound together with paper or tape. So, the border you're seeing is the matt or a combination of the matt and the binding paper/tape on the edge of the slide. Read a blog post about lantern slides here that explains the process in more detail: blog.photography.si.edu/2009/10/02/understanding-the-magi...
